data.Sentence_cn: 幸运的发现
data.Sentence: --- lesson 34  A happy discovery

data.Sentence_cn: 古玩店对许多人来说有一种特殊的魅力。
data.Sentence: Antique shops exert a peculiar fascination on a great many people.

data.Sentence_cn: 高档一点的古玩店为了防尘，把文物漂亮地陈列在玻璃柜子里，那里往往令人望而却步。
data.Sentence: The more expensive kind of antique shop where rare objects are beautifully displayed in glass cases to keep them free from dust is usually a forbidding place.

data.Sentence_cn: 而对不太装腔作势的古玩店，无论是谁都不用壮着胆子才敢往里进。
data.Sentence: But no one has to muster up courage to enter a less pretentious antique shop.

data.Sentence_cn: 人们还常常有希望在发霉、阴暗、杂乱无章、迷宫般的店堂里，从杂乱地摆放在地面上的、一堆堆各式各样的破烂货里找到一件稀世珍品。
data.Sentence: There is always hope that in its labyrinth of musty, dark, disordered rooms a real rarity will be found amongst the piles of assorted junk that litter the floors.

data.Sentence_cn: 无论是谁都不会一下子就发现一件珍品。
data.Sentence: No one discovers a rarity by chance.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个到处找便宜的人必须具有耐心，而且最重要的是看到珍品时要有鉴别珍品的能力。
data.Sentence: A truly dedicated bargain hunter must have patience, and above all, the ability to recognize the worth of something when he sees it.

data.Sentence_cn: 要做到这一点，他至少要像古董商一样懂行。
data.Sentence: To do this, he must be at least as knowledgeable as the dealer.

data.Sentence_cn: 他必须像一个专心致志进行探索的科学家那样抱有这样的希望，即终有一天，他的努力会取得丰硕的成果。
data.Sentence: Like a scientist bent on making a discovery, he must cherish the hope that one day he will be amply rewarded.

data.Sentence_cn: 我的老朋友弗兰克.哈利戴正是这样一个人。
data.Sentence: My old friend, Frank Halliday, is just such a person.

data.Sentence_cn: 他多次向我详细讲他如何只花50英镑便买到一位名家的杰作。
data.Sentence: He has often described to me how he picked up a masterpiece for a mere £50.

data.Sentence_cn: 一个星期六的上午，弗兰克去了我家附近的一家古玩店。
data.Sentence: One Saturday morning, Frank visited an antique shop in my neighbourhood.

data.Sentence_cn: 由于他从未去过那儿，结果他发现了许多有趣的东西。
data.Sentence: As he had never been there before, he found a great deal to interest him.

data.Sentence_cn: 上午很快过去了，弗兰克正准备离去，突然看见地板上放着一只体积很大的货箱。
data.Sentence: The morning passed rapidly and Frank was about to leave when he noticed a large packing case lying on the floor.

data.Sentence_cn: 古董商告诉他那只货箱刚到不久，但他嫌麻烦不想把它打开。
data.Sentence: The dealer told him that it had just come in, but that he could not be bothered to open it.

data.Sentence_cn: 经弗兰克恳求，古董商才勉强把货箱撬开了。
data.Sentence: Frank begged him to do so and the dealer reluctantly prised it open.

data.Sentence_cn: 箱内东西令人失望。
data.Sentence: The contents were disappointing.

data.Sentence_cn: 除了一柄式样别致、雕有花纹的匕首外，货箱内装满陶器，而且大部分都已破碎。
data.Sentence: Apart from an interesting-looking carved dagger, the box was full of crockery, much of it broken.

data.Sentence_cn: 弗兰克轻轻地把陶器拿出箱子，突然发现在箱底有一幅微型画，
data.Sentence: Frank gently lifted the crockery out of the box and suddenly noticed a miniature painting at the bottom of the packing case.

data.Sentence_cn: 画面构图与纸条使他想起一幅他所熟悉的意大利画，于是他决定将画买了下来。
data.Sentence: As its composition and line reminded him of an Italian painting he knew well, he decided to buy it.

data.Sentence_cn: 古董商漫不经心看了一眼那幅画，告诉弗兰克那画值50英镑。
data.Sentence: Glancing at it briefly, the dealer told him that it was worth £50.

data.Sentence_cn: 弗兰克几乎无法掩饰自己兴奋的心情，因为他明白自己发现了一件珍品。
data.Sentence: Frank could hardly conceal his excitement, for he knew that he had made a real discovery.

data.Sentence_cn: 那幅不大的画原来是柯勒乔的一幅未被发现的杰作，价值几十万英镑。
data.Sentence: The tiny painting proved to be an unknown masterpiece by Correggio and was worth hundreds of thousands of pounds.
